title: 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005), with
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 13) (Emergency Measures 
in the Public Interest-Jobseeker’s Benefit) Regulations 2020. 

(2) These Regulations and the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020 shall be construed together as 
one and may be cited together as the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, 
Payments and Control) Regulations 2007 to 2020. 

Emergency measures in the public interest - jobseeker’s benefit

title: 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005), with
heading: 2. Article 52H (amended by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated
text_raw:
2. Article 52H (amended by article 2 of the Social Welfare (Consolidated 
Claims, Payments and Control) (Amendment) (No. 11) (Emergency Measures 
in the Public Interest-Jobseeker’s Benefit) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 310 of 
2020)) of the Social Welfare (Consolidated Claims, Payments and Control) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 142 of 2007) is amended by the 
substitution of the following sub-article for sub-article (2): 

“(2) This article shall cease to have effect on 31 December 2020.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 29th September, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [369] 3 

The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the forgoing 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

24 September, 2020. 

MICHAEL MCGRATH, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

17 September, 2020. 

HEATHER HUMPHREYS, 

Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection.

title: 1 of 2020)) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 (No. 26 of 2005), with
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations temporarily extend, until 31 December 2020, the period 
whereby the rule in section 62(4) of the Social Welfare Consolidation Act 2005 
is suspended. That rule, which provides that Jobseeker’s Benefit is paid only 
from the fourth day of unemployment, will be waived until 31 December 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [369] 5
